aim4.driver

Class Wallet

  • java.lang.Object
    • aim4.driver.Wallet

  • public class Wallet
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Wallet()
      Generates a wallet with a random starting balance to be used over a single intersection.
      Wallet(double minRange, double maxRange)
      generates a wallet with a random starting balance within a given range.
      Wallet(double initialBid, double initialFunds, int intersectionsInTrip)
      Generates a wallet with a specified set of parameters.
      Wallet(double minRange, double maxRange, int intersectionsInTrip, double surplusFactor)
      generates a wallet with a random starting balance within a given range over a given number of intersections.
      Wallet(int intersectionsInTrip, double surplusFactor)
      Generates a wallet with a random starting balance to be used over a given number of intersections.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Wallet

        public Wallet()
        Generates a wallet with a random starting balance to be used over a single intersection.

      • Wallet

        public Wallet(int intersectionsInTrip,
              double surplusFactor)
        Generates a wallet with a random starting balance to be used over a given number of intersections.
        Parameters:
        intersectionsInTrip - Sets the number of intersections expected to use this wallet
        surplusFactor - Sets the factor which increases or decreases the totalFundsAvailable after it is used to generate an initial bid. 0.5 translates a 50% reduction in the generated totalFundsAvailable, 1.5 translates to a 50% increase in the generated total funds available, 1 denotes no change. this can increase or decrease the total funds available beyond the default range.

      • Wallet

        public Wallet(double minRange,
              double maxRange)
        generates a wallet with a random starting balance within a given range.
        Parameters:
        minRange - the smallest possible value that may be generated
        maxRange - the largest possible value that may be generated

      • Wallet

        public Wallet(double minRange,
              double maxRange,
              int intersectionsInTrip,
              double surplusFactor)
        generates a wallet with a random starting balance within a given range over a given number of intersections.
        Parameters:
        minRange - the smallest possible value that may be generated
        maxRange - the largest possible value that may be generated
        intersectionsInTrip - Sets the number of intersections expected to use this wallet
        surplusFactor - Sets the factor which increases or decreases the totalFundsAvailable after it is used to generate an initial bid. 0.5 translates a 50% reduction in the generated totalFundsAvailable, 1.5 translates to a 50% increase in the generated total funds available, 1 denotes no change. this can increase or decrease the total funds available beyond the specified range.

      • Wallet

        public Wallet(double initialBid,
              double initialFunds,
              int intersectionsInTrip)
        Generates a wallet with a specified set of parameters.
        Parameters:
        initialBid - Sets the initial bid and becomes the default bid if the wallet is used over multiple intersections
        initialFunds - Sets the total amount stored in this wallet
        intersectionsInTrip - Sets the number of intersections expected to use this wallet

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentBid

        public double getCurrentBid()
        Returns:
        the bid of the current vehicle

      • getRemainingFunds

        public double getRemainingFunds()
        returns the current funds in the wallet
        Returns:
        total funds in wallet

      • setBid

        public double setBid(double amount,
                     boolean complex)
        Sets a new default bid amount and can be set before each intersection.
        Parameters:
        amount - The new default bid
        complex - Whether the new default bid is constrained by the remaining total funds available
        Returns:

      • setWalletAmount

        public void setWalletAmount(double amount)
        Sets the new total wallet balance.
        Parameters:
        amount - the new wallet balance to be entered

      • processBid

        public double processBid()
        Subtracts current bid from funds, calculates new bid to store if the current bid reduces the wallets funds to a negative value.
        Returns:
        The total remaining funds after accepting the new bid

      • processBid

        public double processBid(double modifier)
        Subtracts current bid from funds, calculates new bid to store if the current bid reduces the wallets funds to a negative value.
        Parameters:
        modifier - modifies the calculation of a new bid before subtracting from the wallet funds
        Returns:
        The total remaining funds after accepting the new bid
